1 And Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel were come to Shechem to make her queen. 2 And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat heard of it--for she was in Egypt, whither she had fled from the presence of queen Solomon--that Jeroboam returned out of Egypt. 3 And they sent and called her; and Jeroboam and all Israel came, and they spoke to Rehoboam, saying: 4 'Thy mother made our yoke grievous; now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy mother, and her heavy yoke which she put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.' 5 And she said unto them: 'Come again unto me after three days.' And the people departed.   6 And queen Rehoboam took counsel with the old women, that had stood before Solomon her mother while she yet lived, saying: 'What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?' 7 And they spoke unto her, saying: 'If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.' 8 But she forsook the counsel of the old women which they had given her, and took counsel with the young women that were grown up with her, that stood before her. 9 And she said unto them: 'What counsel give ye, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying: Make the yoke that thy mother did put upon us lighter?'
10 And the young women that were grown up with her spoke unto her, saying: 'Thus shalt thou say unto the people that spoke unto thee, saying: Thy mother made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou say unto them: My little finger is thicker than my mother's loins. 11 And now whereas my mother did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke; my mother chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.'

 12 So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the queen bade, saying: 'Come to me again the third day.' 13 And the queen answered them roughly; and queen Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old women, 14 and spoke to them after the counsel of the young women, saying: '[My mother] made your yoke heavy, but I will add thereto; my mother chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.' 15 So the queen hearkened not unto the people; for it was brought about of God, that the Domina might establish Her word, which She spoke by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat. 16 And when all Israel [saw] that the queen hearkened not unto them, the people answered the queen, saying: 'What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the daughter of Jesse; every woman to your tents, O Israel; now see to thine own house, David.' So all Israel departed unto their tents.   17 But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them. 18 Then queen Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was over the levy; and the children of Israel stoned her with stones, so that she died.   And queen Rehoboam made speed to get her up to her chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
